36 """
37 Generate HTML reports from coverage.py (aka python-coverage). This is
38 currently a no-frills backend tool.
39 """
40 
41 import sys
42 
43 import roslib
44 
45 try:
46  import coverage
47 except ImportError:
48  sys.stderr.write("ERROR: cannot import python-coverage, coverage report will not run.\nTo install coverage, run 'easy_install coverage'\n")
49  sys.exit(1)
50 
51 
52 def coverage_html():
53  import os.path
54  if not os.path.isfile('.coverage-modules'):
55  sys.stderr.write('No .coverage-modules file; nothing to do\n')
56  return
57 
58  with open('.coverage-modules', 'r') as f:
59  modules = [x for x in f.read().split('\n') if x.strip()]
60 
61  cov = coverage.coverage()
62  cov.load()
63 
64  # import everything
65  for m in modules:
66  try:
67  base = m.split('.')[0]
68  roslib.load_manifest(base)
69  __import__(m)
70  except Exception:
71  sys.stderr.write('WARN: cannot import %s\n' % (base))
72 
73  modlist = '\n'.join([' * %s' % m for m in modules])
74  sys.stdout.write('Generating for\n%s\n' % (modlist))
75 
76  # load the module instances to pass to coverage so it can generate annotation html reports
77  mods = []
78 
79  # TODO: rewrite, buggy
80  for m in modules:
81  mods.extend([v for v in sys.modules.values() if v and v.__name__.startswith(m) and v not in mods])
82 
83  # dump the output to covhtml directory
84  cov.html_report(mods, directory='covhtml')
85 
86 
87 if __name__ == '__main__':
88  coverage_html()
pycoverage_to_html.coverage_html
def coverage_html()
